## ###############################################################################################
## Based on SNPs and indels called in all normals (n=37), how many normals does a "target" variant 
## appear in ?  More than 2 or 3 would suggest that the variant is actually a germline variant.
## ###############################################################################################

```{r}
library(plyr) # for revalue function
library(dplyr)    # filter
library(hashmap) # for hashmap function

# read in target variants
target.calls <- read.table("/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/snv_indel_datasets/snvs_indels.30_final.default_and_optimized.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, fill = TRUE)

# read in the list of genes for which to validate variants for:
#target.genes <- unique(read.table("/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/normal_SNP_analysis/to_validate_round2/target_genes_to_validate.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE))
target.genes <- unique(read.table("/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/normal_SNP_analysis/to_validate_round3/target_genes_to_validate.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE))

# extract target calls
target.calls <- filter(target.calls, target.calls$gene %in% target.genes$gene)

# read in normal SNPs (only need sample, chrom, pos, ref, and alt positions)
snps.normals <- read.table("/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/normal_SNP_analysis/varScan/all.single_samples.varScan.snps.snpEff_canonical.filtered.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, fill = TRUE)
colnames(snps.normals) <- c("normal_id", "chr", "pos", "ref", "alt", "allele_freq", "gene")
snps.normals$allele_freq <- gsub("(.*)\\%(.*)","\\1", snps.normals$allele_freq)

# read in normal indels 
indels.normals <- read.table("/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/normal_SNP_analysis/varScan/all.single_samples.varScan.indels.snpEff_canonical.indels_annotated.cut.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, fill = TRUE)
colnames(indels.normals) <- c("normal_id", "chr", "pos", "ref", "alt", "allele_freq", "gene")
indels.normals$allele_freq <- gsub("(.*)\\%(.*)","\\1", indels.normals$allele_freq)

# combine snps and indels
calls.normals <- rbind(snps.normals, indels.normals)
rm(snps.normals)
rm(indels.normals)

# filter for SNPs that occur in target genes
calls.normals <- filter(calls.normals, calls.normals$gene %in% target.genes$gene)
  
# create keys to cross-reference: "chr", "pos", "ref", "alt"
calls.normals$key <- as.character(paste(
  calls.normals$chr,
  calls.normals$pos,
  calls.normals$ref,
  calls.normals$alt,
  sep = "."
))

#write.table(calls.normals, "/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/normal_SNP_analysis/varScan/snps_and_indels.target_genes.round2.txt", sep = "\t", quote = FALSE, row.names = FALSE)
write.table(calls.normals, "/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/normal_SNP_analysis/varScan/snps_and_indels.target_genes.round3.txt", sep = "\t", quote = FALSE, row.names = FALSE)

target.calls$key <- as.character(paste(
  target.calls$chr,
  target.calls$pos,
  target.calls$ref,
  target.calls$alt,
  sep = "."
))

# create a table of snps
snps.counts <- as.data.frame(table(calls.normals$key))
colnames(snps.counts) <- c("snp", "num_normals")
hash.snp.counts <- hashmap(as.character(snps.counts$snp), as.numeric(snps.counts$num_normals))

target.calls$num_normals <- 0

# now cross reference target calls with snps 
for (i in 1:nrow(target.calls)){
  target.calls[i, ]$num_normals <- hash.snp.counts[[target.calls[i, ]$key]]
}

#write.table(target.calls, "/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/snv_indel_datasets/snvs_indels.30_final.default_and_optimized.num_normals.v3_targets.txt", sep = "\t", quote = FALSE, row.names = FALSE)
write.table(target.calls, "/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/snv_indel_datasets/snvs_indels.30_final.default_and_optimized.num_normals.MutSig_new_targets.txt", sep = "\t", quote = FALSE, row.names = FALSE)

# extract germline variants that had a hit in the target list:
calls.normals <- filter(calls.normals, calls.normals$key %in% target.calls$key)

write.table(calls.normals, "/Volumes/shung/projects/gzl_exomes/snv_analysis-20181127/normal_SNP_analysis/to_validate_round3/snps_and_indels.target_variants.txt", sep = "\t", quote = FALSE, row.names = FALSE)
```
